poem:
Fixing the Cracks

Louise Casey, builder of bridges  
over troubled waters,   
navigates the intricate veins of care,  
blueprints sketched in empathy's ink—  
patching roofs over head and heart.  
Her quarry: resolve, mortar of plans,  
each brick laid with the steady hand  
of history's fifth call, singing  
in the echo of footsteps on her path.
